name: paper-dropdown-menu-light

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.description:
The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents. Set it to
`null` to disable the listeners.

properties.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
properties.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: pressed
properties.description: If true, the user is currently holding down the button.

properties.name: toggles
properties.description:
If true, the button toggles the active state with each tap or press
of the spacebar.

properties.name: active
properties.description: If true, the button is a toggle and is currently in the active state.

properties.name: pointerDown
properties.description:
True if the element is currently being pressed by a "pointer," which
is loosely defined as mouse or touch input (but specifically excluding
keyboard input).

properties.name: receivedFocusFromKeyboard
properties.description:
True if the input device that caused the element to receive focus
was a keyboard.

properties.name: ariaActiveAttribute
properties.description:
The aria attribute to be set if the button is a toggle and in the
active state.

properties.name: focused
properties.description: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: noink
properties.description:
If true, the element will not produce a ripple effect when interacted
with via the pointer.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The value for this element that will be used when submitting in
a form. It is read only, and will always have the same value
as `selectedItemLabel`.

properties.name: required
properties.description:
Set to true to mark the input as required. If used in a form, a
custom element that uses this behavior should also use
Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior and define a custom validation method.
Otherwise, a `required` element will always be considered valid.
It's also strongly recommended to provide a visual style for the element
when its value is invalid.

properties.name: validator
properties.description: Name of the validator to use.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: True if the last call to `validate` is invalid.

properties.name: selectedItemLabel
properties.description:
The derived "label" of the currently selected item. This value
is the `label` property on the selected item if set, or else the
trimmed text content of the selected item.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description:
The last selected item. An item is selected if the dropdown menu has
a child with class `dropdown-content`, and that child triggers an
`iron-select` event with the selected `item` in the `detail`.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label for the dropdown.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: The placeholder for the dropdown.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the dropdown is open. Otherwise, false.

properties.name: allowOutsideScroll
properties.description:
By default, the dropdown will constrain scrolling on the page
to itself when opened.
Set to true in order to prevent scroll from being constrained
to the dropdown when it opens.

properties.name: noLabelFloat
properties.description:
Set to true to disable the floating label. Bind this to the
`<paper-input-container>`'s `noLabelFloat` property.

properties.name: alwaysFloatLabel
properties.description:
Set to true to always float the label. Bind this to the
`<paper-input-container>`'s `alwaysFloatLabel` property.

properties.name: noAnimations
properties.description:
Set to true to disable animations when opening and closing the
dropdown.

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the menu dropdown
horizontally relative to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the menu dropdown
vertically relative to the dropdown trigger.

properties.name: contentElement
properties.description: The content element that is contained by the dropdown menu, if any.

methods.name: addOwnKeyBinding
methods.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

methods.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
methods.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

methods.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
methods.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

methods.name: ensureRipple
methods.description:
Ensures this element contains a ripple effect. For startup efficiency
the ripple effect is dynamically on demand when needed.

methods.name: getRipple
methods.description:
Returns the `<paper-ripple>` element used by this element to create
ripple effects. The element's ripple is created on demand, when
necessary, and calling this method will force the
ripple to be created.

methods.name: hasRipple
methods.description: Returns true if this element currently contains a ripple effect.

methods.name: validate

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
Deprecated: The value to be validated. By default,
it is passed to the validator's `validate()` function, if a validator is set.
If this argument is not specified, then the element's `value` property
is used, if it exists.

description:
Material design: [Dropdown menus](https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/buttons.html#buttons-dropdown-buttons)

This is a faster, lighter version of `paper-dropdown-menu`, that does not
use a `<paper-input>` internally. Use this element if you're concerned about
the performance of this element, i.e., if you plan on using many dropdowns on
the same page. Note that this element has a slightly different styling API
than `paper-dropdown-menu`.

`paper-dropdown-menu-light` is similar to a native browser select element.
`paper-dropdown-menu-light` works with selectable content. The currently selected
item is displayed in the control. If no item is selected, the `label` is
displayed instead.

Example:

    <paper-dropdown-menu-light label="Your favourite pastry">
      <paper-listbox slot="dropdown-content">
        <paper-item>Croissant</paper-item>
        <paper-item>Donut</paper-item>
        <paper-item>Financier</paper-item>
        <paper-item>Madeleine</paper-item>
      </paper-listbox>
    </paper-dropdown-menu-light>

This example renders a dropdown menu with 4 options.

The child element with the slot `dropdown-content` is used as the dropdown
menu. This can be a [`paper-listbox`](paper-listbox), or any other or
element that acts like an [`iron-selector`](iron-selector).

Specifically, the menu child must fire an
[`iron-select`](iron-selector#event-iron-select) event when one of its
children is selected, and an [`iron-deselect`](iron-selector#event-iron-deselect)
event when a child is deselected. The selected or deselected item must
be passed as the event's `detail.item` property.

Applications can listen for the `iron-select` and `iron-deselect` events
to react when options are selected and deselected.

### Styling

The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-dropdown-menu` | A mixin that is applied to the element host | `{}`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-disabled` | A mixin that is applied to the element host when disabled | `{}`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-ripple` | A mixin that is applied to the internal ripple | `{}`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-button` | A mixin that is applied to the internal menu button | `{}`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-icon` | A mixin that is applied to the internal icon | `{}`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-disabled-opacity` | The opacity of the dropdown when disabled  | `0.33`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-color` | The color of the input/label/underline when the dropdown is unfocused | `--primary-text-color`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-focus-color` | The color of the label/underline when the dropdown is focused  | `--primary-color`
`--paper-dropdown-error-color` | The color of the label/underline when the dropdown is invalid  | `--error-color`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-label` | Mixin applied to the label | `{}`
`--paper-dropdown-menu-input` | Mixin appled to the input | `{}`

Note that in this element, the underline is just the bottom border of the "input".
To style it:

    <style is=custom-style>
      paper-dropdown-menu-light.custom {
        --paper-dropdown-menu-input: {
          border-bottom: 2px dashed lavender;
        };
    </style>
